hackathon-judges.judge-role: Program Manager  at UC Davis Health
Public Relations Officer at Habitat for Humanity
Researcher at UC Davis Information Security Office

hackathon-eligibility: All previously registered and RSVPd students can take part.
hackathon-requirements:
- YOU MUST BE REGISTERED FOR HACKDAVIS TO WORK ON A PROJECT FOR SUBMISSION. (And have checked-in to the event)
- Your project must be completed entirely during hacking hours and not before
- You cannot work on your project before hacking begins (which is officially 12:00PM PT on Saturday, January 20st, 2018)
- You must submit your project by 12:00PM on Sunday, January 21st. You can continue hacking until noon or until the countdown goes to 0. 
- You cannot steal another team's code in any way, shape, or form 
- The decision of judges is final for determining prizes and awards
- Max of four team members per team

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: $200 Amex gift card for each team member.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Health and Wellness Hack by Centene Corporations

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: 6 month free trial of Balsamiq Desktop and drones for each team member.
$200 Amazon giftcard for team, and a Google Home for each team member.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Education Hack by Services for International Students and Scholars

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Audio-Technica headphones for each team member.
Amazon Echos for each team member. Please note, at least half of the team must be first time hackers for this prize.
A Google Home, and Google Cardboard for each team member.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Google Cloud Platform Hack by Google Cloud

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: 12 months of extended access to AI DevCloud, and a drone for each team member.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Use of Intel AI DevCloud by Intel

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Digital Multimeters for each team member.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Use of Keysight Hardware by Keysight
Best Use of Osisoft's API by Osisoft

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Backpack, Raspberry Pi, and Bluetooth Speaker for team.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Hack With Open Public Sector Data Sources by KPMG

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: The winning team enters into the UC PLASMA 12-week accelerator. As part of the program, your team will receive $1500 in seed funding with potential for up to $10k at the completion of the 12-week program. To be eligible, one founding team member must be available all Mondays 1/29 - 4/28 from 6-8 pm.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Startup Idea by UC Plasma
Best Hack Using a .tech Domain by .tech
Amazon Web Services - Best Use of AWS

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Raspberry Pi and PiHut Essential Kit
Qualcomm DragonBoard 410c and power source for each team member.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best IoT Hack Using a Qualcomm Device

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=The ARC- Activities and Recreation Center, 232 One Shields Avenue, Davis, CA 95616, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: How technically impressive is the project? If competing in an API/hardware usage category, was the API/hardware used extensively?
How complete is the project? Is it just on the design stage, coding stage, etc.? Ideally the project has 1 or more functionality finished, or close to finishing.
Has this project been done before? Does the project make others think this is a really cool idea why didn’t I think of that?
How beneficial will this project be to its target it audience? How much will it impact their lives? Are people likely to use it often, and will they have a good experience when doing so?

hackathon-location-address: The ARC- Activities and Recreation Center, 232 One Shields Avenue, Davis, CA 95616, USA
hackathon-description-header: UC Davis's premier hackathon for social good is back with 3 main tracks: education, environment, and health.
